required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: ASSURE WCD Clinical Evaluation - Post Approval Study (ACE-PAS)
clinical_study.official_title: ASSURE WCD Clinical Evaluation - Post Approval Study (ACE-PAS)

brief_summary.textblock: Active surveillance study using real-world data collected in the ASSURE Patient Registry. Outcome measures are based on analysis of ASSURE Registry data including data recorded by the WCD then annotated by clinical experts in electrophysiology.

primary_outcome.description: Percent of spontaneous episodes of ventricular tachycardia/ventricular fibrillation (VT/VF) successfully converted with one or more shocks ≥ 89.0%
Total inappropriate shocks/cumulative months of WCD use for all patients ≤ 0.0075

secondary_outcome.description: Percent of spontaneous episodes of ventricular tachycardia/ventricular fibrillation (VT/VF) converted with a single shock. (report only)
Percent of patients who experience at least one inappropriate shock (report only)

other_outcome.description: Number of appropriate shocks/cumulative months of WCD use
Percent of patients who experience at least one appropriate shock
Number of shocks diverted by patients
Number of false positive shock alarms/cumulative WCD use
Number of true positive shock alarms/cumulative WCD use
Adverse events related to use of the WCD
Average daily use of the WCD in hours per day

arm_group.description: Patient prescribed the ASSURE WCD who have also consented to participate in the ASSURE Patient Registry. Patients include those with reduced left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) and recent myocardial infarction, recent coronary revascularization, or new onset heart failure (HF) to allow for optimization of medical therapy and re-evaluation of cardiac function. Additional indications include ICD explant due to infection, postponed ICD implant, and pending heart transplant.

intervention.description: External defibrillation from a wearable cardioverter defibrillator

study_pop.textblock: The ASSURE Wearable Cardioverter Defibrillator (WCD) system is indicated for adult patients who are at risk or at perceived risk of sudden cardiac arrest (SCA) and are not immediate candidates for, or refuse, an implantable defibrillator.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patient prescribed the ASSURE wearable cardioverter defibrillator
- Provided written informed consent to participate in the ASSURE Patient Registry
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who do not meet the Inclusion criteria
